meanings.definition: The act of bringing together or organizing into a collective or communal system.
meanings.sent1: The collectivization of resources helped the community work together for a common goal.
meanings.sent2: The collectivization of ideas in the meeting led to a successful project.
meanings.sent3: The collectivization of toys in the playroom made it easier for everyone to share.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was like the collectivization of a beehive, with everyone working in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The collectivization of voices in the choir created a beautiful harmony.

meanings.definition: The process of converting private property into collective or state ownership.
meanings.sent1: The collectivization of land was a major step towards equality in the country.
meanings.sent2: The collectivization of factories helped boost the economy.
meanings.sent3: The collectivization of the old building turned it into a community center.
meanings.sent4: The collectivization of ideas transformed the company into a collaborative environment.
meanings.sent5: The collectivization of responsibilities among the team members improved efficiency.

meanings.definition: The policy of combining individual farms or enterprises into collective units.
meanings.sent1: The collectivization of farms increased productivity in the region.
meanings.sent2: The collectivization of businesses led to shared success among owners.
meanings.sent3: The collectivization of tasks in the office made teamwork essential.
meanings.sent4: The collectivization of efforts resulted in a stronger community bond.
meanings.sent5: The collectivization of skills among team members created a well-rounded workforce.
